title: Create Ad Decisioning Server
name: Create_Ad_Decisioning_Server
description: Create an adServer, defining the base URL and query string variables that will be fired to your ad provider for a single VAST ad or DFP/SmartXML ad playlist response. Please see our guide for Converting an ad tag for the Once Media Management API.

Request Body Fields.description: The new adServer’s name
The new adServer’s base URL
An object set of query string key/value pairs to be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time. If your base URL requires no variables, include an empty variables object ("variables": {})

examples.title: Create Ad Decisioning Server Request Body Example:

Response Fields.description: An object set of query string key/value pairs to be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time. Response variable order may not match your original input, this is expected and will not affect ad tag performance.

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Delete Ad Decisioning Server
name: Delete_Ad_Decisioning_Server
description: Deletes the specified ad decisioning server. NOTE: This change will remove any application adConfigs utilizing the deleted adServer.

examples.title: Delete Ad Decisioning Server Request Body Example:

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Get Ad Decisioning Server Details
name: Get_Ad_Decisioning_Server_Details
description: Retrieves details of a specified adServer.

Response Fields.description: An object set of query string key/value pairs which will be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Get All Ad Decisioning Servers
name: Get_All_Ad_Decisioning_Servers
description: Retrieves all ad decisioning servers configured in the domain. This method returns 20 results by default, totalResults indicates the total number of applications in the domain, previous and/or next page request URLs will be included within the response if necessary. URL Parameters may be appended to modify result sets.

URL Parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request
The set of items (based on pageSize) to return
Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"
Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"
Sort ascending or descending.

Response Fields.description: URL to GET the previous adServer result set (if necessary)
URL to GET the next adServer result set (if necessary)
The total number of adServer in the domain

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Update Ad Decisioning Server
name: Update_Ad_Decisioning_Server
description: Update the specified adServer’s name, base URL, and/or variables. NOTE: This change will affect any application adConfigs utilizing the updated adServer. If you need an updated adServer configuration without changing existing applications or ad configurations, create a new adServer and then create or modify applications and their adConfigs to use the new adServer.

Request Body Fields.description: The new adServer’s name
The new adServer’s base URL
An object set of query string key/value pairs to be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time. If your base URL requires no variables, include an empty variables object ("variables": {})

examples.title: Create Ad Decisioning Server Request Body Example:

Response Fields.description: An object set of query string key/value pairs to be inserted/appended to the base URL at request time. Response variable order may not match your original input, this is expected and will not affect ad tag performance.

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Add or Replace Application Ad Configuration
name: Add_or_Replace_Application_Ad_Configuration
description:
Add or replace the adConfig assigned to the specified application. Below are two examples:

  1. Single VAST ad request(s) will be made for each configured adPosition (preRoll, midRoll, and/or postRoll).
  2. Multiple (ad) configuration, enabling an ad decisioning server to specify all ad breaks in a single response (Freewheel SmartXML, DFP Ad Rules).

Request Body Fields Example 1.description: A single VAST adConfig for the preRoll slot
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad
A single VAST adConfig for the midRoll slot
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad
A single VAST adConfig for the postRoll slot
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad

Request Body Fields Example 2.description: An adConfig where a single request will return a full, multiple ad load
The adServerId which will be requested for the multiple ad load
The multiple adServer configuration type. Syntax must be dfp or smartxml

Response Fields Example 1.description: The applicationId
The application's name
The application’s parent domainId
An object set of ads configured to the application
A single VAST adConfig for the preRoll slot
The adConfigId
The adConfig’s name
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad
The adServer’s name
The position into which the ad will be inserted (preRoll)
A single VAST adConfig for the midRoll slot
The adConfigId
The adConfig’s name
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad
The adServer’s name
The position into which the ad will be inserted (midRoll)
A single VAST adConfig for the postRoll slot
The adConfigId
The adConfig’s name
The adServerId which will be requested for a single VAST ad
The adServer’s name
The position into which the ad will be inserted (postRoll)
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the preRoll position
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the miodRoll position
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the postRoll position

Response Fields Example 2.description: An object set of ads configured to the application
An adConfig where a single request will return a full, multiple ad load
The adServerId which will be requested for the multiple ad load
Leave at zero (the adServer will determine number of ads returned for preRoll position)
Leave at zero (the adServer will determine number of ads returned for midRoll position)
Leave at zero (the adServer will determine number of ads returned for postRoll position)

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Create Application
name: Create_Application
description: Creates an new application in the domain.

Request Body Fields.description: Name of the new application
Number of single VAST ads to be requested for the preRoll position (required only if using single VAST adConfig)
Number of single VAST ads to be requested for the midRoll position (required only if using single VAST adConfig)
Number of single VAST ads to be requested for the postRoll position (required only if using single VAST adConfig)

Response Fields.description: Will remain null until adConfig has been added (see methods below)
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the preRoll position
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the midRoll position
The number of single VAST ads to be requested for the postRoll position

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Delete Application
name: Delete_Application
description: Deletes an application from the domain. This method will delete all of the application’s adConfigs, but will not delete any related adServer(s). See below for a method to delete adServers.

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Get All Applications
name: Get_All_Applications
description: Returns all applications configured in the domain. This method returns 20 results by default, totalResults indicates the total number of applications in the domain, previous and/or next page request URLs will be included within the response if necessary. URL Parameters may be appended to modify result sets.

The set of items (based on pageSize) to return

The total number of applications in the domain

Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Add Catalog Rendition
name: Add_Catalog_Rendition
description: Add the specified new rendition to a catalog’s rendition set. New mediaItems ingested to the catalog will be assigned the specified rendition. NOTE: This method will not add the specified rendition to existing mediaItems in the catalog. Please contact Support if you also need new renditions assigned to previously-ingested mediaItems.

Request Body Fields.description: a rendition id to add

examples.title: Add Catalog Rendition Request Body Example:

Response Fields.description: The new renditionId to be added to the catalog

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Create Catalog
name: Create_Catalog
description: Creates a new catalog within the parent domainId. You may specify renditions when creating the catalog, otherwise it will be assigned all domain renditions marked as default. The new catalog will also inherit any domain publication rules.

Request Body Fields.description: The new catalog name
An array of renditions to be assigned to the catalog. If omitted, catalog will be assigned default domain renditions.
Each renditionId to be assigned to the catalog

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Create Catalog Publication Rule
name: Create_Catalog_Publication_Rule
description: Create a catalog publication rule. NOTE: A new catalog publication rule created by this method will only be applied to new mediaItems ingested to the catalog, but will not be applied to existing mediaItems within. Please see below for a method to create or update publication rules assigned to individual mediaItems.

Request Body Fields.description: Epoch time (in seconds) when publication rule becomes effective
Epoch time (in seconds) when publication rule expires
Array of client-based filters
The type of client variable being filtered
A string against which requests will be filtered
The method of filtering against the value string
True: All other values will be permitted; False: Only this value will be permitted
Array of country-based filters
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code being filtered
True: All other values will be permitted; False: Only this value will be permitted

examples.title: Create Catalog Publication Rule Request Body Example:

Response Fields.description: Epoch time (in seconds) when publication rule becomes effective,
Epoch time (in seconds) when publication rule expires,
The type of client variable being filtered: (IpAddress, UserAgent, ReferringHost),
A string against which requests will be filtered,
The method of filtering against the value string: (Equals, NotEquals, In, NotIn, Contains, NotContains, StartsWith, NotStartsWith, EndsWith, NotEndsWith),
True: All other values will be permitted; False: Only this value will be permitted
True: All other values will be permitted; False: Only this value will be permitted

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Delete Catalog Rendition
name: Delete_Catalog_Rendition
description: Delete the specified rendition from a catalog’s rendition set. New mediaItems ingested to the catalog will no longer be assigned the specified rendition. NOTE: This method will not remove the specified rendition from existing mediaItems in the catalog. Please contact Support if you also need the specified rendition removed from previously-ingested mediaItems.

Path Parameters.description: The rendition id to remove from the catalog set

Response Fields.description: The renditionId removed from the catalog rendition set

Error 4xx.description: Request 400: Bad Request — Incorrect or invalid request body
403: Forbidden — Missing or incorrect API Key
Found 404: Not Found — Incorrect or invalid URL path

title: Get All Catalog Publication Rules
name: Get_All_Catalog_Publication_Rules
description: Retrieves all publicationRuleIds assigned to a Catalog. Please review the Content Restriction section of our Once VOD 2.0 Guide for details on what Publication Rules can do and how they are inherited.

Response Fields.description: A comma-separated array of publicationRuleIds assigned to the catalog (will be inherited by mediaItems ingested to the catalog)

title: Delete Domain Publication Rule
name: Delete_Domain_Publication_Rule
description: Deletes the specified domain publication rule. NOTE: Deleting a domain publication rule will prevent it from being added to new catalogs, but will not delete publication rules of existing catalogs or mediaItems within. Please see below for methods to delete publication rules assigned to catalogs or mediaItems.

Path Parameters.description: The domain id for your Once account

title: Get All MediaItems In Catalog
name: Get_All_MediaItems_In_Catalog
description: Returns a collection of all media items within a catalog. This method fetches 20 media items per page, returns the totalResult to indicate the total number of media items and provides the previous or next page requests within the body.

URL Parameters.description: The number of items to return for the request
The set of items (based on pageSize) to return
Filter to media items that have title substring. E.g. title=foo could return media items with title "foo", "foobar", "foorific"
Filter to media items that have foreign key substring. E.g. foreignKey=foo could return media items with foreign key "foo", "foobar", "foorific"
Filter to applications that have name substring. E.g. name=foo could return applications named "foo", "foobar", "foorific"
Sort ascending or descending.

Response Fields.description: The iteration of that specific mediaItem (will increment if a new version of the video is ingested)
The iteration of that specific mediaItem (will increment if a new version of the video is ingested)
to GET the previous mediaItem result set (if necessary)
total number of mediaItems in the catalog

The catalogId
The domainId
The unique identifier for the asset (max length: 255 characters)
